billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO INVESTIGATIONS AND GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

title: Disallows corporate and personal income tax deductions for property in continued noncompliance with regard to rent impairing violations
summary: Disallows corporate and personal income tax deductions for interest, depreciation, taxes or amortization for persons who own real property offered for lease which is in continued non-compliance with regards to rent impairing violations; requires local housing officials to submit list of such non-compliant landlords to the division of housing and community renewal.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K

                                          952

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                      (PREFILED)

       Introduced  by  Sen.  MARCELLINO  -- read twice and ordered printed, and
         when printed to be committed to the Committee  on  Investigations  and
         Government Operations

       AN ACT to amend the tax law, the multiple dwelling law, and the multiple
         residence  law,  in  relation  to  disallowing  corporate and personal
         income tax deductions for property  in  continued  noncompliance  with
         regard to rent impairing violations

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 210 of the tax law  is  amended  by  adding  a  new
    2  subdivision 24-a to read as follows:
    3    24-A.  NOTWITHSTANDING  ANY  CONTRARY  PROVISION  OF LAW, NO DEDUCTION
    4  SHALL BE PERMITTED FOR INTEREST, TAXES,  DEPRECIATION,  OR  AMORTIZATION
    5  PAID  OR INCURRED IN THE TAXABLE YEAR FOR ANY PROPERTY OFFERED FOR LEASE
    6  WHICH IS IN  CONTINUED  NONCOMPLIANCE  WITH  REGARD  TO  RENT  IMPAIRING
    7  VIOLATIONS  AS DEFINED BY: (A) LOCAL LAWS, REGULATIONS, OR ORDINANCES OR
    8  (B) PARAGRAPH A OF SUBDIVISION TWO OF SECTION THREE HUNDRED TWO-A OF THE
    9  MULTIPLE DWELLING LAW AND SECTION THREE HUNDRED FIVE-A OF  THE  MULTIPLE
   10  RESIDENCE  LAW.  FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, "CONTINUED NONCOMPLI-
   11  ANCE" SHALL MEAN  THAT  SUCH  VIOLATION  OR  VIOLATIONS  HAVE  NOT  BEEN
   12  CORRECTED  WITHIN  THE  PRESCRIBED  COMPLIANCE  PERIOD,  DESPITE WRITTEN
   13  NOTIFICATION TO THE OWNER BY  THE  LOCAL  DEPARTMENT  CHARGED  WITH  THE
   14  ENFORCEMENT OF SUCH LAWS, REGULATIONS, OR ORDINANCES. WITH THE EXCEPTION
   15  OF  REASONABLE  ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES, ALL ADDITIONAL REVENUE REALIZED
   16  AND COLLECTED BY THE DEPARTMENT AS A RESULT OF ANY DEDUCTION  DISALLOWED
   17  IN  ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL BE REMITTED
   18  TO THE LOCALITY IN WHICH THE  PROPERTY  WHICH  IS  THE  SUBJECT  OF  THE
   19  VIOLATION IS LOCATED IN ORDER TO PROMOTE AND ENHANCE HOUSING MAINTENANCE
   20  ENFORCEMENT EFFORTS IN SUCH LOCALITY.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04408-01-1

       S. 952                              2

    1    S 2. Subsection (b) of section 612 of the tax law is amended by adding
    2  a new paragraph 40 to read as follows:
    3    (40)  DEDUCTIONS, INCLUDING INTEREST, TAXES, DEPRECIATION, AND AMORTI-
    4  ZATION ALLOWED IN DETERMINING FEDERAL ADJUSTED GROSS INCOME AND INCURRED
    5  IN THE TAXABLE YEAR ON ANY  PROPERTY  OFFERED  FOR  LEASE  WHICH  IS  IN
    6  CONTINUED  NONCOMPLIANCE  WITH  REGARD  TO  RENT IMPAIRING VIOLATIONS AS
    7  DEFINED IN SECTION TWO HUNDRED TEN OF THIS CHAPTER.
    8    S 3. Section 303 of the multiple dwelling law is amended by adding two
    9  new subdivisions 1-b and 1-c to read as follows:
   10    1-B. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY CONTRARY  PROVISION  OF  LAW,  LOCAL  HOUSING
   11  ENTITIES  OR DEPARTMENTS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE TRACKING AND/OR MAINTAINING
   12  OF RECORDS, FILES AND/OR AFFIDAVITS OF PERSONS FOUND TO BE IN  CONTINUED
   13  NONCOMPLIANCE  WITH  REGARD  TO RENT IMPAIRING VIOLATIONS SHALL SUBMIT A
   14  LISTING OF THOSE PERSONS FOUND IN NONCOMPLIANCE TO THE DIVISION OF HOUS-
   15  ING AND COMMUNITY RENEWAL WITHIN THIRTY DAYS AFTER  THE  THIRD  RECORDED
   16  VIOLATION.  FOR  THE  PURPOSES  OF THIS SECTION, THE TERM "PERSON" SHALL
   17  INCLUDE THE OWNER, MORTGAGEE, VENDEE, FIRM OR CORPORATION IN  POSSESSION
   18  OF  OR DIRECTLY IN CONTROL OF A DWELLING OR PART THEREOF. THE TERM "RENT
   19  IMPAIRING VIOLATIONS" SHALL BE DEFINED BY: (A) LOCAL  LAWS,  REGULATIONS
   20  OR  ORDINANCES,  OR  (B) PARAGRAPH A OF SUBDIVISION TWO OF SECTION THREE
   21  HUNDRED TWO-A OF THIS ARTICLE AND SECTION THREE HUNDRED  FIVE-A  OF  THE
   22  MULTIPLE  RESIDENCE LAW.  "CONTINUED NONCOMPLIANCE", FOR THE PURPOSES OF
   23  THIS SECTION, SHALL MEAN THAT SUCH VIOLATION OR VIOLATIONS HAVE NOT BEEN
   24  CORRECTED WITHIN  THE  PRESCRIBED  COMPLIANCE  PERIOD,  DESPITE  WRITTEN
   25  NOTIFICATION  TO  THE  OWNER  BY  THE  LOCAL DEPARTMENT CHARGED WITH THE
   26  ENFORCEMENT OF SUCH LAWS, REGULATIONS OR ORDINANCES.
   27    1-C. (A) WHEN THE COMPLIANCE PERIOD PRESCRIBED BY THE  DEPARTMENT  FOR
   28  THE  CORRECTION OF: (1) A RENT IMPAIRING VIOLATION AS DEFINED IN SECTION
   29  THREE HUNDRED TWO-A OF THIS ARTICLE; OR (2)  A  VIOLATION  OF  STATE  OR
   30  LOCAL  LAW,  ORDINANCE  OR REGULATION, WHICH CONSTITUTES A THREAT TO THE
   31  LIFE, HEALTH OR SAFETY OF THE PUBLIC HAS EXPIRED, THE  DEPARTMENT  SHALL
   32  MAIL  TO  THE  BUILDING  OWNER  A NOTICE OF NONCOMPLIANCE. THE NOTICE OF
   33  NONCOMPLIANCE SHALL BE MAILED BY CERTIFIED MAIL TO THE BUILDING OWNER AT
   34  HIS OR HER LAST KNOWN ADDRESS, AND SHALL ADVISE SUCH  OWNER  (A)  OF  AN
   35  INTENT  TO  NOTIFY  THE DIVISION OF HOUSING AND COMMUNITY RENEWAL WITHIN
   36  THIRTY DAYS OF THE  THIRD  RECORDED  NONCOMPLIANCE  AND  THE  SUBSEQUENT
   37  NOTIFICATION  OF  THE DEPARTMENT OF TAXATION AND FINANCE BY THE DIVISION
   38  AFTER TEN DAYS, AND (B) A GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF THE TAX CONSEQUENCES OF
   39  SUCH FILING WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF TAXATION AND FINANCE. AFTER THE EXPI-
   40  RATION OF SUCH TEN DAY PERIOD, THE DIVISION MAY NOTIFY THE DEPARTMENT OF
   41  TAXATION AND FINANCE OF SUCH NONCOMPLIANCE. SUCH  NOTICE  SHALL  INCLUDE
   42  THE  NAME OF THE OWNER OR OWNERS, THE LOCATION OF THE DWELLING, THE DATE
   43  THE VIOLATION OR VIOLATIONS WERE RECORDED AND SUCH OTHER INFORMATION  AS
   44  THE  DEPARTMENT  OF  TAXATION AND FINANCE MAY REQUEST.  IN THE EVENT THE
   45  PERIOD OF NONCOMPLIANCE DOES NOT  COVER  AN  ENTIRE  TAXABLE  YEAR,  THE
   46  DEDUCTIONS  SHALL  BE  DENIED  AT  THE RATE OF ONE-TWELFTH FOR EACH FULL
   47  MONTH OR PART THEREOF DURING THE PERIOD OF NONCOMPLIANCE.
   48    (B) FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SUBDIVISION, A NOTICE OF NONCOMPLIANCE  SHALL
   49  NOT  BE  MAILED BY THE ENFORCEMENT DEPARTMENT TO THE DIVISION OF HOUSING
   50  AND COMMUNITY RENEWAL IF THE VIOLATION WAS CAUSED SOLELY  BY  REASON  OF
   51  NATURAL  DISASTER  EXCEPT WHERE SUCH CONDITION REMAINS FOR MORE THAN SIX
   52  MONTHS.
   53    S 4. Section 303 of the multiple residence law is amended by adding  a
   54  new subdivision 7 to read as follows:
   55    7.  A. WHEN THE COMPLIANCE PERIOD PRESCRIBED BY THE DEPARTMENT FOR THE
   56  CORRECTION OF: (I) A RENT IMPAIRING  VIOLATION  AS  DEFINED  IN  SECTION

       S. 952                              3

    1  THREE HUNDRED TWO-A OF THE MULTIPLE DWELLING LAW; OR (II) A VIOLATION OF
    2  STATE  OR LOCAL LAW, ORDINANCE OR REGULATION, WHICH CONSTITUTES A THREAT
    3  TO THE LIFE, HEALTH AND SAFETY OF THE PUBLIC HAS EXPIRED, THE DEPARTMENT
    4  SHALL  MAIL  TO THE BUILDING OWNER A NOTICE OF NONCOMPLIANCE. THE NOTICE
    5  OF NONCOMPLIANCE SHALL BE MAILED BY CERTIFIED MAIL TO THE BUILDING OWNER
    6  AT HIS OR HER LAST KNOWN ADDRESS, AND SHALL ADVISE SUCH OWNER (1) OF  AN
    7  INTENT  TO  NOTIFY  THE DIVISION OF HOUSING AND COMMUNITY RENEWAL WITHIN
    8  THIRTY DAYS OF THE  THIRD  RECORDED  NONCOMPLIANCE  AND  THE  SUBSEQUENT
    9  NOTIFICATION  OF  THE DEPARTMENT OF TAXATION AND FINANCE BY THE DIVISION
   10  AFTER TEN DAYS, AND (2) A GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF THE TAX CONSEQUENCES OF
   11  SUCH FILING WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF TAXATION AND FINANCE. AFTER THE EXPI-
   12  RATION OF SUCH TEN DAY PERIOD, THE DIVISION MAY NOTIFY THE DEPARTMENT OF
   13  TAXATION AND FINANCE OF SUCH NONCOMPLIANCE. SUCH  NOTICE  SHALL  INCLUDE
   14  THE  NAME OF THE OWNER OR OWNERS, THE LOCATION OF THE DWELLING, THE DATE
   15  THE VIOLATION OR VIOLATIONS WERE RECORDED AND SUCH OTHER INFORMATION  AS
   16  THE  DEPARTMENT  OF  TAXATION AND FINANCE MAY REQUEST.  IN THE EVENT THE
   17  PERIOD OF NONCOMPLIANCE DOES NOT  COVER  AN  ENTIRE  TAXABLE  YEAR,  THE
   18  DEDUCTIONS  SHALL  BE  DENIED  AT  THE RATE OF ONE-TWELFTH FOR EACH FULL
   19  MONTH OR PART THEREOF DURING THE PERIOD OF NONCOMPLIANCE.
   20    B. FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SUBDIVISION, A NOTICE OF  NONCOMPLIANCE  SHALL
   21  NOT  BE  MAILED BY THE ENFORCEMENT DEPARTMENT TO THE DIVISION OF HOUSING
   22  AND COMMUNITY RENEWAL IF THE VIOLATION WAS CAUSED SOLELY  BY  REASON  OF
   23  NATURAL  DISASTER  EXCEPT WHERE SUCH CONDITION REMAINS FOR MORE THAN SIX
   24  MONTHS.
   25    S 5. This act shall take effect immediately and shall apply to taxable
   26  years beginning on or after the first of January of the  year  in  which
   27  this  act  shall have become a law, and to all violations recorded on or
   28  after such date.
